units.title: Cell trajectory inference
units.text: To follow cell trajectories over time, we used CellRank47 to infer the terminal macrostates (myocytic, epicardial, endothelial and endodermal) and the probability of each cell to transition toward these states based on both pseudotime and RNA velocity information (Fig. 4b and Extended Data Fig. 7a).
units.rationale: Identifies the computational method for mapping cell fate decisions.

units.title: Lentiviral transduction of epicardioids
units.text: Epicardioids differentiated from hiPSCs were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding FLP under the control of the CDH1 promoter at day 15 before analysis at day 24.
units.rationale: Introduces FLP recombinase for lineage tracing at a defined developmental stage.

units.title: 4‑OHT induction at JCF stage
units.text: 4-hydroxytamoxifen (4-OHT) was applied at the beginning of the JCF stage (days 7–8; Fig. 4e and Extended Data Fig. 8a).
units.rationale: Activates the inducible FLP recombinase to label JCF cells.

units.title: Immunofluorescence validation on day 12
units.text: On day 12, immunofluorescence analysis revealed HA-tag+ CMs and epicardial cells (both mesothelial and EPDCs), confirming the dual fate potential of epicardial cells.
units.rationale: Confirms successful labeling and differentiation outcomes.

units.title: ISL1 immunostaining in fetal tissue
units.text: We performed ISL1 immunostaining in human fetal heart tissue to verify ISL1 expression.
units.rationale: Validates the presence of a key progenitor marker in native tissue.

units.title: Generation of FLP‑reporter hiPSC line
units.text: We generated an hiPSC reporter line in which a flippase (FLP) recognition target (FRT)-flanked neomycin cassette (mKate2) fused to a hemagglutinin (HA) tag was knocked into the AAVS1 safe harbor locus.
units.rationale: Creates a stable reporter system for downstream lineage tracing.

units.title: JCF lineage tracing vector transduction
units.text: For JCF lineage tracing, epicardioids from this reporter line were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding an inducible FLP (FLP-ERT2) under the control of the MAB21L2 promoter at day 3, and after 72 h, we detected HA-tag+CDH1+ cells, indicating correct labeling of the mesothelial layer.
units.rationale: Specifies the timing and promoter used to target early JCF cells.

units.title: Metacell subclustering analysis
units.text: We performed subclustering of the metacell dataset to investigate the timing of JCF progenitors.
units.rationale: Analyzes single‑cell data to resolve progenitor subpopulations.

units.title: Second 4‑OHT pulse at days 4‑5
units.text: We applied 4-OHT at the corresponding stage (days 4–5; Extended Data Fig. 8c).
units.rationale: Provides an additional labeling window to capture later progenitor states.

units.title: Quantification of lineage outcomes
units.text: In this case, 78.4% of HA-tag+ cells differentiated into CMs compared to 54.7% when applying 4-OHT at the JCF stage (Fig. 4f and Extended Data Fig. 8d).
units.rationale: Measures the efficiency of fate decisions after temporal labeling.
